author: benjaminion
content: I did a write up of the genesis process for Eth2, focusing on Medalla. Turns out that there's lot of confusion about this, including with me ðŸ˜‚ https://hackmd.io/@benjaminion/genesis

author: vtech0383
content: Hi guys, i am trying to do the medalla setup? after running "sh deposit.sh" my console stops afte "Type the password that secures your validator keystore(s):"   I gave the password and pressed enter

author: vtech0383
content: but nothing happes

author: vtech0383
content: appreciate your help

author: vtech0383
content: i am following the window setup on my pc

author: jgm
content:
> I did a write up of the genesis process for Eth2, focusing on Medalla. Turns out that there's lot of confusion about this, including with me ðŸ˜‚ https://hackmd.io/@benjaminion/genesis
<@!573787335796326400> Nice write-up.  Note that any deposits in blocks after the block in which the 16384th deposit is made will enter the queue, so anyone depositing now won't be a genesis validator but will go through the queue process the same way as someone that deposits after genesis (albeit further ahead in the queue)

author: djrtwo
content: not true!

author: nishant0
content: actually not true

author: djrtwo
content: ðŸ™‚ confusion indeed

author: nishant0
content: they will still be included

author: nishant0
content: yeap , I learnt it the hard way ðŸ™‚

author: djrtwo
content: the first block to hit all the conditions is the block that decides the genesis state

author: djrtwo
content: "all the conditions" meaning the timestamp (plus genesis delay) hits min_genesis_time and the total deposits hit the min_active_validator_count

author: nishant0
content: the block needs to satisfy the 2 genesis conditions, once that is satisfied all deposits till the eth1block are included in the genesis state

author: benjaminion
content: As evidence, Altona had min validators set to 640, but we ended up with 685 in the genesis state (I think all active - need to double chexk!).

author: jgm
content: Ooh, thought that anything beyond the "genesis" eth1 block was added to the queue.  Will have to go and re-read.

author: jgm
content: So genesis validators can be any number >16384, as long as they get in in time?  Interesting.

author: nishant0
content: yeap, pretty much

author: terence0083
content: We've setup some Prysmatic labs bootnodes for Medalla. PR has the ENRs: https://github.com/goerli/medalla/pull/32

author: arnetheduck
content: so in altona we had people running a validator then losing interest - in part, I'd think that this is because it's not really well documented anywhere how to _stop_ being a validator - ie launchpad doesn't seem to mention it.

author: ryg9705
content: <@!449019668296892420> Agreed. You have to really dig in to find out that it's possible to do a voluntary exit, dig in more to find out that you can't reenter until phase 1 and no instructions how to actually do it.

author: benjaminion
content: We don't actually support voluntary exit yet on Teku. I mean, why would anyone want to stop using Teku ðŸ˜›
